title: S&P: Sliding Seems To Be Steeper Shortly, Despite Higher Opening
text:
On analysis of the movements of Index, in different time frames, S&P 500 seems to be facing stiff resistance at 3016; where it opened on Thursday and continue to face sell off amid growing uncertainty due to upcoming Sino-U.S. deal during the mid of November, 2019. No doubt that a successful deal will not only benefit both the major economies of the worlds that started this 15-month long tussle; but will also save other economies of the world from more damage. I find that the steady gold prices look evident enough to move more upward due to growing fear of global economic slowdown, if this tariff trade tussle is not resolved shortly.

Finally, I conclude that a steep downward move of S&P 500 Index below the level of 2957 will confirm the continuity of this exhaustive move up to the level of 2828.
